No Poverty.reason: Course focuses on cross border digital trade and international business competitiveness; poverty reduction is not a primary focus.

Zero Hunger.reason: No discussion of food security or hunger issues.

Good Health and Well-being.reason: No direct coverage of health or well-being topics; indirect relevance only through trade impacts on economic resilience.

Quality Education.reason: Course provides specialized knowledge in digital trade and emerging technologies, contributing to higher education and professional skills.

Gender Equality.reason: No explicit discussion of gender equality in the course description or syllabus.

Clean Water and Sanitation.reason: No direct coverage of water or sanitation issues.

Affordable and Clean Energy.reason: Energy issues are not a focus; course concentrates on digital trade infrastructure.

Decent Work and Economic Growth.reason: Course promotes understanding of digital trade systems, global value chains, and economic competitiveness, supporting economic growth and business innovation.

Industry, Innovation and Infrastructure.reason: Course emphasizes digital trade technologies, blockchain, cloud computing, and international trade infrastructure, directly supporting innovation and industry development.

Reduced Inequalities.reason: No direct focus on reducing social or economic inequalities; may indirectly impact by facilitating trade access.

Sustainable Cities and Communities.reason: Course does not directly address urban sustainability or community resilience.

Responsible Consumption and Production.reason: No coverage of sustainable production or consumption practices.

Climate Action.reason: No explicit discussion of climate change or environmental sustainability.

Life Below Water.reason: No content related to marine ecosystems or biodiversity.

Life on Land.reason: No content related to terrestrial ecosystems or biodiversity.

Peace, Justice and Strong Institutions.reason: Course touches on regulatory frameworks and international trade agreements, providing minor relevance to governance and institutional processes.

Partnerships for the Goals.reason: Course covers international initiatives, regional integration, and public-private partnerships in digital trade, aligning with collaborative global goals.
